decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of card draw, disruption, and powerful win conditions to quickly assemble the Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle combo. By leveraging Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Dig Through Time to filter through the deck and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck aims to set up a winning board state with either Inverter of Truth or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries comboed with Thassa's Oracle for a game-ending win condition.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap artifact creatures and artifacts to quickly power up their creatures and deal damage to the opponent. By combining cards like Ensoul Artifact and All That Glitters with cards like Springleaf Drum and Steel Overseer, the deck aims to create a strong board presence early on and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. With cards like Metallic Rebuke and Shrapnel Blast to control the board and deal direct damage, this deck is all about pushing through damage quickly and efficiently.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly flood the board with small creatures, gain life through them and trigger abilities that benefit from gaining life. The inclusion of Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Ajani's Pridemate allows for a powerful synergy with lifegain. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and pump them up with various effects, while also having some resilience with Selfless Spirit and protection with Alseid of Life's Bounty. The deck also includes some control elements with Daxos, Blessed by the Sun and removal with Walking Ballista.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent by playing efficient and versatile creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Gifted Aetherborn, backed up by removal spells like Fatal Push and Murderous Rider. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with Thoughtseize and Rankle, Master of Pranks while maintaining a steady stream of threats with cards like Scrapheap Scrounger and Bloodsoaked Champion. The deck's game plan revolves around controlling the board and draining the opponent's life total quickly.

The deck focuses on playing efficient and aggressive Spirit creatures that benefit from each other's presence on the battlefield. The goal is to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with flying creatures. The deck also includes spells like Collected Company to bring out additional threats and disruption in the form of Spell Queller. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to the different colors needed for the creatures and spells in the deck.

The primary focus of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and graveyard hate. It also aims to control the board with powerful planeswalkers and versatile creatures. The deck utilizes cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, Jace, Vryn's Prodigy, and Ashiok, Nightmare Muse to outvalue and outpace opponents. The inclusion of cards like Uro and Emrakul, the Promised End provide additional win conditions for the deck. Overall, the strategy revolves around resource management and outmaneuvering the opponent.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive and low-cost creatures in mono white. The deck utilizes cards like Walking Ballista, Knight of the White Orchid, and Heliod, Sun-Crowned to quickly build up a board presence and pressure the opponent. It also includes cards like Gideon's Intervention and Elspeth Conquers Death for tempo and disruption. The deck has a strong mana base with Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Castle Ardenvale to help ramp up and generate additional tokens. Overall, the strategy revolves around quickly building a powerful board state and finishing the opponent off before they can stabilize.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle, allowing the player to win the game by decking themselves in one turn. The deck runs a suite of disruption spells and removal to control the game until it can assemble the combo. Dig Through Time helps the player find the combo pieces quickly, while cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries provide additional card advantage and win conditions. The goal is to outmaneuver the opponent and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Llanowar Elves and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to play powerful green creatures and planeswalkers like Voracious Hydra and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and increase green devotion to maximize the abilities of cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger. The inclusion of Karn, the Great Creator allows for additional artifact-based options, while utility lands like Castle Garenbrig and Wolfwillow Haven help accelerate the mana base.

The deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost spirit creatures to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. By utilizing cards like Collected Company to quickly put creatures onto the battlefield, combined with anthem effects from cards like Supreme Phantom and Empyrean Eagle, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total and maintain board presence. Spell Queller and Brazen Borrower provide additional disruptive elements to control the opponent's plays, while Selfless Spirit and Rattlechains provide protection for key creatures. The deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent with a fast and relentless assault.

This Spirit Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures like Mausoleum Wanderer and Spectral Sailor, supported by anthem effects from Supreme Phantom and Empyrean Eagle. The deck also includes disruptive elements such as Spell Queller and Nebelgast Herald to control the opponent's spells and creatures. Collected Company provides additional creature advantage, while Curious Obsession can draw cards off of attacking creatures. With efficient threats and the ability to disrupt the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive spirit creatures.

The main focus of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 Spirit Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature strategy. By utilizing cards like Empyrean Eagle and Supreme Phantom to pump up your spirits, as well as disruptive spells like Spell Queller and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game, this deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain tempo throughout the match. The inclusion of versatile cards like Brazen Borrower and Ojutai's Command allows for adaptability in different situations, while the mana base ensures consistency in casting your spells.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on early disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also utilizing powerful threats like Questing Beast and Nissa, Vastwood Seer to quickly close out games. The deck also includes versatile removal options such as Abrupt Decay and Assassin's Trophy, as well as card advantage engines like Liliana, the Last Hope and Tireless Tracker. By combining efficient removal, disruptive spells, and efficient threats, this deck aims to apply pressure quickly and efficiently while controlling the board to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence of low-cost creatures (aggro) in order to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes powerful white creatures like Gideon of the Trials, Heliod, Sun-Crowned, and Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit, supported by cards like Knight of the White Orchid and Walking Ballista. The deck also includes some removal and protection spells like Baffling End and Stasis Snare. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Castle Ardenvale.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy low-cost artifact creatures and enchant them with Ensoul Artifact or Skilled Animator to turn them into powerful threats. The deck aims to attack aggressively, utilizing cards like Stonecoil Serpent, Bomat Courier, and Gingerbrute to deal damage efficiently. Additionally, cards like Shrapnel Blast and Shadowspear provide additional reach and removal options, while cards like Key to the City and Hope of Ghirapur disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck relies on a combination of artifact synergy and aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for explosive combo plays. The key concept revolves around using cards like Hidden Strings, Pore Over the Pages, and Vizier of Tumbling Sands to untap Lotus Field multiple times in a turn, chaining together spells to set up a win condition. The deck also includes Underworld Breach for graveyard recursion and Fae of Wishes for accessing sideboard options to deal with different situations. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to react.

This combo deck aims to quickly assemble Lotus Field along with other key pieces such as Underworld Breach and Hidden Strings to generate a large amount of mana and go off in a single turn. Cards like Arboreal Grazer and Vizier of Tumbling Sands help ramp and untap Lotus Field, while Fae of Wishes can search for crucial combo pieces. The deck also includes card draw and filtering spells to find combo pieces quickly. The goal is to set up a board state where the player can play and activate multiple spells in a turn to overwhelm the opponent.

The main idea of this Red Aggro deck is to flood the board with efficient and aggressive creatures like Anax, Bonecrusher Giant, and Goblin Rabblemaster, backed up by burn spells like Lightning Strike and Wild Slash for removal. The deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total using creatures with haste and direct damage spells, while also benefiting from the synergy between cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Rimrock Knight. The inclusion of Embercleave provides a powerful finisher to close out games swiftly.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive spirits that can fly and boost each other's power. By using cards like Empyrean Eagle and Supreme Phantom to pump up the team, combined with disruptive spells like Spell Queller and Nebelgast Herald, the deck aims to control the board while dealing quick damage to the opponent. Collected Company allows for flash speed creature deployment, enabling surprise attacks and maintaining pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and facilitate smooth gameplay.

The main focus of this deck is to use ramp effects to accelerate mana production and play powerful threats from the hand, such as Nissa, Ugin, and Uro. These threats are able to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with their strong abilities and high stats. The deck's goal is to outvalue and outpace the opponent by quickly ramping into its big threats and establishing a dominant board presence. Additionally, cards like Tamiyo and Satyr Wayfinder provide card advantage and help ensure a steady stream of threats throughout the game.
